## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 215, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>

<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 584, 106]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
An arithmetic progression has first term 4 and common difference \(d\). The sum of the first \(n\) terms of the progression is 5863.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 125, 146, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 121, 425, 144]]<|/det|>
Show that \((n - 1)d = \frac{11726}{n} - 8.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 125, 920, 144]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 440, 185, 459]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 440, 920, 460]]<|/det|>
Given that the \(n\)th term is 139, find the values of \(n\) and \(d\), giving the value of \(d\) as a fraction. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 99, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 78, 146, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 658, 102]]<|/det|>
The curve with equation \(y = x^{2} + 2x - 5\) is translated by \(\left(- \frac{1}{3}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 115, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the translated curve, giving your answer in the form \(y = ax^{2} + bx + c\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 588, 186, 606]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[181, 588, 920, 609]]<|/det|>
The curve with equation \(y = x^{2} + 2x - 5\) is transformed to a curve with equation \(y = 4x^{2} + 4x - 5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 621, 655, 642]]<|/det|>
Describe fully the single transformation that has been applied.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 622, 920, 641]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 457, 102]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 107, 292, 131]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A point is moving along the curve \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) in such a way that, as it passes through the point \(A\), its \(y\)-coordinate is **decreasing** at the rate of \(k\) units per second and its \(x\)-coordinate is **increasing** at the rate of \(k\) units per second.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 148, 153]]<|/det|>
